mods.note: MAP 34 RATIONS NEAR RAMADI September, 1917. NOTE. British positions at 6 p.m. 28* h September shown in red. Turkish main entrenchments shown in green. FT S / o i.y /cP - - A /APREPARED IN THE HISTORICAL SECTION OF THE COMMITTEE OF IMPERIAL DEFENCE. Ordnance Survey, 1926. MAP 34?

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'MAP 34 TO ILLUSTRATE OPERATIONS NEAR RAMADI. July and September, 1917.'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed on paperDimensions: 167 x 297mm, on sheet 209 x 354mm

mods.abstract: The map accompanies The Campaign in Mesopotamia 1914-1918. Volume IV, and shows a region around Ramadi in central Iraq, indicating military positions, towns, settlements, routes, cultivation and watercourses. Sketch marks give some indication of relief, and a brief note on the right-hand side describes British and Turkish positions printed in red and green.Prepared in the Historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defence, and printed at the Ordnance Survey in 1926.
